legalAid.eligiblityText: This section does not apply to your offense.
legalAid.helperText: Please hit the "start over" button in the upper left hand corner.

ineligibleSkip.eligiblityText: This section does not apply to your offense.
ineligibleSkip.helperText: Please hit the "start over" button in the upper left hand corner.

ineligibleFJ.eligiblityText: You may be eligible, read below.
ineligibleFJ.helperText: You may be eligible after you appear before the proper authority in jurisdiction that issued the warrant. (Please contact the Community Defender Division for information on sealing under "Fugitive from justice arrest 16-803.01")

eligibleFJ.eligiblityText: This fugitive from justice arrest may be eligible for sealing.
eligibleFJ.helperText: (Please contact the Community Defender Division for information on sealing under "Fugitive from justice arrest 16-803.01")

eligibleFJ2.eligiblityText: You may be eligible once you have documentation showing you have appeared before the proper authority in the demanding jurisdiction.
eligibleFJ2.helperText: (Please contact the Community Defender Division for information on sealing under "Fugitive from justice arrest 16-803.01")

endStates.comment200: *****************START OF INCORRECT CRIMINAL RECORD END STATES *********************

eligibleIC.eligiblityText: You may be eligible to file.
helperText: Contact the Community Defender Division of the Public Defender Service for information on the process for completing a fingerprint comparison.

eligibleIC2.eligiblityText: You may be eligible to file.
eligibleIC2.helperText: You may file a motion to seal if there are no fingerprints to compare and if you swear under penalty of perjury that the record you are trying to seal is not yours.

eligibleIC3.eligiblityText: You may be eligible to file.
eligibleIC3.helperText: If you are unsure whether the record is yours, contact Community Defender Division of the Public Defender Service for information on getting a fingerprint comparison.

ineligibleAI.eligiblityText: Convictions are not eligible for sealing under actual innocence.
ineligibleAI.helperText: You may be eligible to seal under a different statute.  Also, if you were convicted and can now prove you are innocent, you may be eligible to challenge that conviction. Contact the Community Defender Division of the Public Defender Service for information.

ineligibleAI2.eligiblityText: Based on your responses, you may not be able to file for sealing under Actual Innocence.
helperText: Please hit the "start over" button in the upper left hand corner to your eligibility under another option.

eligibleAI.eligiblityText: You may be eligible for sealing with no waiting period.
helperText: However, please note, that if it has been more than four years after the prosecution was terminated, then you will have to provide more convincing evidence of your innocence.

eligibleDOa.eligiblityText: You may be eligible to file to seal the records of this arrest and may be able to file at any time.
eligibleDOa.helperText: PDS or another lawyer will be able to advise you about whether your alleged conduct is now decriminalized or legalized

eligibleDOb.eligiblityText: If in this particular arrest, you were only arrested for a marijuana-related offense and only charged with a marijuana-related offense, then you may be eligible to file to seal the records of this arrest.   PDS or another lawyer will be able to advise you about whether your alleged conduct is now decriminalized or legalized.
eligibleDOb.helperText: PDS or another lawyer will be able to advise you about whether your alleged conduct is now decriminalized or legalized.

0.questionText: Do you have access to your complete criminal record right now?

50.questionText: Your offense may be eligible for sealing under one of the following categories. Please select an option that applies to your D.C. Criminal Record.

answers.answerText: I was arrested in DC because I had a warrant in another jurisdiction (i.e. another state).
My DC criminal record is INCORRECT. There are cases or arrests listed that are not mine.  Someone may have used my name or the information was entered incorrectly.
I was arrested for or charged with a crime in DC, BUT I was NOT convicted of it, AND I can prove to the Court that I was actually innocent.
I was arrested, charged or convicted of a marijuana-related offense before February 26, 2015.
I was arrested in DC because I had a warrant in another jurisdiction (i.e. another state).
My DC criminal record is INCORRECT. There are cases or arrests listed that are not mine.  Someone may have used my name or the information was entered incorrectly.
I was arrested for or charged with a crime in DC, BUT I was NOT convicted of it, AND I can prove to the Court that I was actually innocent.
I was arrested, charged or convicted of a marijuana-related offense before February 26, 2015.

100.questionText: Were you arrested in DC because you had a warrant in another jurisdiction (i.e. another state)?

101.questionText: Have you appeared before the proper authority in the jurisdiction that issued the warrant?
helperText: The proper authority is the court that issued the warrant.

102.questionText: Can you prove that you appeared before the proper authority in the jurisdiction that issued the warrant?

questions.comment200: *****************START OF INCORRECT CRIMINAL RECORD END STATES *********************

200.questionText: Does your criminal record incorrectly identify you as having a case or arrest that is NOT yours?
helperText: (For example – Someone used your name when they were arrested or a data entry error has linked your name or other identifying information to a case that is not yours)

201.questionText: Do you know if the person who was actually responsible for the offense was fingerprinted at the time of the arrest?
helperText: (You may know the answer to this if you have submitted fingerprints to the Metropolitan Police Department (MPD) to prove that you were not the person arrested and MPD has told you that they do not have fingerprints on file for that arrest to compare to your prints.)

202.questionText: Can you swear under oath that the record is not yours?
helperText: INSERT definition of swearing under oath and the penalty of perjury.

300.questionText: Were you arrested for or charged with crime but "not convicted" of that crime as defined below?
helperText: "Not convicted" means (a) the prosecutor did not paper or did not charge the case; OR (b) the prosecutor dropped the charges against the you before trial; OR  (c) the court dismissed the charges against the you; OR (d) you were acquitted (found “not guilty”) of the crime after a trial.

301.questionText: Can you prove that the offense for which you were arrested or charged did not occur OR that you did not commit the offense for which you were arrested or charged?
helperText: You have the burden of proving to the Court that you are actually innocent through factual circumstances and/or relevant post offense occurrences that support a conclusion that you were innocent. The easiest way to prove actual innocence is by presenting facts that can be proven by reliable documents.

Example 1: You were found guilty of driving without a permit. You really did have a valid permit at the time but a computer glitch indicated that you did not have one when you were arrested. You can now provide information showing that you had a valid permit at the time of the offense.
Example 2: You were arrested for having a dog off leash but it is not your dog and you can show that it is not your dog.
Example 3: You were arrested for theft but you have a receipt showing you actually own the property you were accused of stealing.

Example 4: You have an assault-type charge but you acted in self-defense. You have to show the Judge you believed you were in imminent harm and acted in self-defense. You could provide affidavits from witnesses who saw the fight and who swear that the "victim" was really the initial aggressor and you, the arrestee, were just defending yourself. However, affidavits saying "the other guy started it" will not be enough to show actual innocence. The judge is still going to have to make credibility findings based on the evidence provided.

400.questionText: Were you arrested, charged or convicted of a marijuana-related offense before February 26, 2015.
helperText:
A marijuana-related offense involves marijuana and any of the following:  
 possession of a controlled substance, 
 possession of drug paraphernalia, 
 possession with the intent to distribute a controlled substance, 
 distribution of a controlled substance, OR  
 an attempt or a conspiracy to commit any of the offenses any of the above.

401.questionText: When you were arrested for, charged with or convicted of a marijuana-related offense, were you ALSO arrested for, charged with or convicted of violating any NON-marijuana related offense or violation of the D.C. Code, the D.C. Municipal Regulations, or the U.S. Code?
